required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Retrospective Evaluation of Risk Factors for Lower Outcomes After Vitrectomy With ILM Flap Technique
clinical_study.official_title: Retrospective Evaluation of Risk Factors for Lower Outcomes After Vitrectomy With ILM Flap

lead_sponsor.agency: Vienna Institute for Research in Ocular Surgery

clinical_study.source: Vienna Institute for Research in Ocular Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: A retrospective review of medical charts of patients having undergone vitrectomy with ILM Peeling and ILM flap technique for macular hole repair.

detailed_description.textblock: A retrospective review of medical charts of patients having undergone vitrectomy with ILM Peeling and ILM flap technique for macular hole repair. Pre- and postoperative OCT and visual acuity in the time period up to 6 months after surgery are reviewed and possible risk factors for failed macular hole closure or lower visual acuity outcome after surgery are assessed.

primary_outcome.time_frame: change between visual acuity 2-6 months postoperative to baseline

primary_outcome.description: closure of the macular hole assesed with OCT

intervention.intervention_name: vitrectomy with ILM peeling and ILM flap technique
intervention.description: outcomes after vitrectomy with ILM peeling and ILM flap technique for macukar hole repair are assessed

study_pop.textblock: all patieints have undergone vitrectomy with ILM peeling and ILM flap technique in the time period form 1.1.2015 to 31.4.2020 for macular hole repair

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Vitrectomy with ILM peeling and ILM flap technique in the time period form 1.1.2015 to 31.4.2020
- Age 18 or older
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age <18

overall_official.affiliation: Vienna Institute for Research in Ocular Surgery

facility.name: Vienna Institute for Research in Ocular Surgery

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Vienna Institute for Research in Ocular Surgery
responsible_party.investigator_full_name: Prim. Prof. Dr. Oliver Findl, MBA
